title: Strategies for Forming and Managing Collaborative Learning Groups

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theories, social studies subject knowledge, and general understanding of collaborative learning
context.additional_context: Environment where prospective teachers develop group formation strategies applicable to real-world settings through collaborative learning design. Flexible learning structure enabling asynchronous collaboration using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three educational factors to consider when forming collaborative learning groups (knowledge level, role distribution, interaction strategies).
Learners can analyze problem situations arising during group formation from a teacher’s perspective and propose solutions.
Learners can design collaborative learning scenarios by applying the principles of an ontology-based framework.
Learners can develop group management strategies applicable to real classroom environments through project-based assessment.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Notion, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
